title: Markets fall again
text:
BBC Copyright: BBC Former Thomas Cook staff protested outside the Conservative Party Conference Image caption: Former Thomas Cook staff protested outside the Conservative Party Conference

Thomas Cook workers made redundant last week will hold a lobby and demonstration in parliament tomorrow.

The workers who were not paid their monthly wages yesterday are angry that they and their company were abandoned by the government, according to the Unite union.

"Workers do not understand how the profitable Thomas Cook airline was allowed to collapse while the European subsidiaries were able to continue to fly," said Unite assistant general secretary Diana Holland.

“The very least the Thomas Cook workers deserve, is to receive an answer to the question as to why the company was allowed to collapse as well an explanation from the government as to its lack of action in the lead up.”

Yesterday workers protested outside the Tory conference.
description: After an up and down day, the FTSE 100 has slipped back into the red.
